title: (x) "Live On" faceted tech sans - Gridnik {Dav}
content:
Hello, i seach this unknown Font!
It see like a Chunkfeeder (http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeco/chunkfeeder/light/win-ttf/154495/), but the edges must be more rounded ...

thx
un_titled
author: formfollowsforce

comments.content:
For an alternative, [Blender.](http://web.archive.org/web/20141112115521/http:/www.die-gestalten.de/fonts/detail/?id=402881820693de75010693de940a000f)

Does anyone know a simpler way of purchasing Foundry Gridnik? At present, the only way I know is to send a form direct to The Foundry.

We had discussions about the 'relationship' between 'Blender' and 'Gridnik', on Typophile, before. _( 'Die Gestalten' released quite a few questionable types, within the recent past. )_

Dav
Dav, I didn't realise the relationship between the two until I read the information on the die-gestalten site, it does seem suspectable. I'll try and dig up that old typophile thread for myself. :^)

_\> Does anyone know a simpler way of purchasing Foundry Gridnik? At present, the only way I know is to send a form direct to The Foundry._

Well, Geoff, That currently seems to be the only way to purchase. Contacting 'The Foundry' and buying / licensing from them, directly.

By the way, the text mentioning 'Gridnik' on the 'Die Gestalten' site is new. Soo, Maybe someone over there read some of the remarks over here. :)

Dav

Okay then, As you seem to still be looking for alternates, you may want to consider ' [Monodon](http://web.archive.org/web/20141112115521/http:/cape.ths.nu/start.php?link=monodon)', by Donald Beekman; ' [Mandrax](http://web.archive.org/web/20141112115521/http:/www.vllg.com/Feliciano/B-Sides/mudTyper+Weights/)', by Mário Feliciano; ' [Vectrex](http://web.archive.org/web/20141112115521/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Categories/Graphic+Fonts/Vectrex/)', by Cornel Windlin, or ' [Mashine](http://web.archive.org/)', by Tim Ahrens.

_And, While you are there, be sure to take a look at [the hilarious Cape Arcona 'Press Conference'](http://web.archive.org/web/20141112115521/http:/cape.ths.nu/start.php?link=press)._

Dav

your are the best :) thanks a lot!

by  
un\_titled
